ios.subtitle: The moving story of a lifetime

editorialNotes.standard: Movingâ€™s a drag! Relocate to this satisfying puzzler in which you unpack boxes filled with all sorts of goodies.

name: A Little to the Left: Drawers

editorialNotes.standard: Neatly arranging fountain pens and acrylic paints not only declutters drawers and cupboards but also soothes our minds.

name: A Little to the Left: Stars

editorialNotes.standard: Solve puzzles, inspect chilling notes and videos, and outrun a nightmarish smiling cat in the third chapter of this freaky horror series.

Years after its debut, The Room remains one of the most absorbing puzzlers weâ€™ve played. Use ingenuity and intuitive controls to manipulate a series of nested boxes and unlock the secret inside. As each thrown switch and decrypted code reveals another intricate enigma, breathtaking sights and eerie sounds weave an irresistible atmosphere of suspense. All the more amazing for being the debut effort from Fireproof Games, The Room beautifully blurs the line between entertainment and artistry.

Mesmerizing from start to finish, Monument Valley offers a world of uncanny beauty and constant wonder. To help a princess proceed on her mysterious quest, youâ€™ll face ingenious puzzles that involve lifting and spinning the environment in seemingly impossible ways. Itâ€™s a mind-bending journey filled with the joy of discovery, making Ustwoâ€™s adventure a must-play for gamers of every experience level.

When dinosaurs collide with LEGO bricks, you donâ€™t have to be Mr. DNA to know the result is pure fun. Starring characters and creatures from all four Jurassic Park movies, this fantastic adventure lets you relive your favorite moments from the series and even create new ones with your own custom dinos. Full of all the humor, action, and surprises you expect, itâ€™s a wacky team-up of T-Rex proportions.

After a long day at work, itâ€™s bath time! But Swampyâ€™s shower is broken and he needs your help to guide the water to him. Navigate a path through the dirt past contraptions and obstacles to get every drop to fill the bath.Â

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: The enchantingly eccentric Rusty Lake series heads underground! Solve strange puzzles in train stations representing different eras of a womanâ€™s life.

editorialNotes.short: Unravel family secrets on a remote island cursed by plagues in this dark puzzle adventure.

editorialNotes.standard: A terrific follow-up to our 2012 iPad Game of the Year, The Room Two continues the dark, foreboding tale introduced in its predecessor. Marvelously detailed graphics and eerie music make this first-person puzzler feel stunningly real, and as you travel from an ancient crypt to a sÃ©ance room and beyond, youâ€™ll love unlocking the secrets of every objectâ€”and learning more about your mysterious imprisonment.

ios.subtitle: A story of beauty and illusion

editorialNotes.standard: We couldnâ€™t wait to go back to the land of twisty towers and uncanny beautyâ€”and this sequel didnâ€™t let us down. With its striking colors and level design, itâ€™s even more stunning than the first game. New elements like light beams and controlling two characters make the puzzles even trickier. The bond between that mother and child is what weâ€™ll remember most, thoughâ€”their relationship moved us in a way few games do.
editorialNotes.short: A powerful bond between mother and child drives this gorgeous, unforgettable game.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Imagination becomes reality in 5th Cellâ€™s spectacular puzzlerâ€”just write the name of almost anything in a magical notebook, and it appears before you. Expanding on the more linear Scribblenauts Remix, this game turns you loose to explore an open world. By creating everything from flying pigs to rocket launchers, you solve problems big and small for the people you meet. As the freedom to roam met the freedom to create, we got lost in coming up with the zaniest, most outlandish, or sometimes most diabolical ways to solve each scenario.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Imagine WALLÂ·E directed by Tim Burtonâ€”thatâ€™s the weird, wonderful world of Machinarium. But this cute robotâ€™s quest for love combines tons more influencesâ€”like point-and-click adventures, hidden-object puzzlers, and comic booksâ€”for a truly unique experience. Challenging but full of awesome â€œaha!â€ moments, itâ€™s an artistic odyssey that looks amazing on iPhone, iPad, or Apple TV.

editorialNotes.tagline: Team up to solve the puzzles

editorialNotes.standard: Limbo is a gripping blend of stark, haunting landscapes, bizarre characters, and unsettling sounds. With clever puzzle design, an intriguing narrative, and an excellent touch-screen control system, itâ€™s as rewarding to play as it is interesting to look at and listen to.
editorialNotes.short: Dark, haunting, beautiful. This'll stay with you long after it's over.

name: Smart Baby Shapes: Learning games for toddler kids

editorialNotes.standard: Cool features like asynchronous multiplayer uplift the mobile version of this hit tabletop word association game.
Are aliens really out there? Discover the truth by rummaging through crop circles, pizza trucks, and more in this interactive hidden-object game.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.tagline: Jump in and save the ninjas!
editorialNotes.standard: Goofy banter, diverting puzzles, wall-to-wall actionâ€”we couldnâ€™t ask for more from a LEGO Ninjago game. Using the warriorsâ€™ trademark weapons and elemental moves, youâ€™ll battle the nefarious Ronin and his crew across Chenâ€™s Island, the Toxic Bogs, and other familiar settings. Even if youâ€™ve never seen the Masters of Spinjitzu animated series, these hilarious heroes and their kid-friendly shenanigans are guaranteed to win you over.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Now hereâ€™s how you build a sequel! With The Room Three, Fireproof Games kept everything we love about this seriesâ€”its chilling atmosphere, mind-bending puzzles, and beautiful visualsâ€”while making masterful enhancements. Itâ€™s no wonder itâ€™s an Honorable Mention for Best Mobile Game at this yearâ€™s Game Developers Conference. The story continues with trials set by a creepy new nemesis, The Craftsman. As you explore huge areas and tiny ones, the challenges feel increasingly epic, and a better-than-ever hint system ensures that finding solutions is super-rewarding.
editorialNotes.short: Brilliant puzzle designs and a haunting atmosphere make this unforgettable.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Put a little sci-fi mystery in your history by unlocking the secrets of computing pioneer Ada Lovelace in this cerebral adventure.
Enigmatic settings and storytelling enrich the mysteries of Leonardo da Vinci's gadgetry in this escape room puzzle seriesâ€™ fantastic conclusion.
Talk about a sticky situation! Build structures with all sorts of goo to stretch this long-awaited physics puzzling sequel to new heights.

The Gardens Between is pure magic. Two friends are transported to a cluster of surreal, spiraling islands populated with treasures from childhood memories. An elegant control system lets you manipulate time to help the pair navigate beautiful puzzles that evoke growth, loss, and friendship. A contemplative game that rewards observation and curiosity, The Gardens Between's inspired creativity is full of heart.
Search for a missing dog through lavishly illustrated cityscapes in this relaxing adventure game.

You might get stuck the first time you play Gorogoa. But once the gears of your brain settle into the right configurations, youâ€™ll see how smart this mix of art and perspective really is. Layers pile upon layers, doors transport you between realities, strange creatures and wild environments blend together into a fascinating interactive collage youâ€™ll want to peel apart to discover what lies underneath.

In Baba Is Youâ€™s brilliant puzzles, rules are meant to be brokenâ€”or at least rewritten. Brick wall standing between you and the victory flag? Shift blocks of text to form phrases that change the way the world works. With a few moves, â€œwall is stopâ€ becomes â€œwall is pushâ€â€”and success is suddenly within your grasp. Youâ€™ll marvel as the game responds instantly to your newly created laws. Spell yourself into a corner? Just rewind and retrace your steps. Baba is you, and youâ€™re in charge.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Put a little â€œbooâ€ in your botany by concocting herbal remedies for odd supernatural ailments in this eerie puzzle-adventure.

A rare kind of triumph, Prune takes a simple ideaâ€”pruning treesâ€”and shapes it into a creative, deeply playable puzzle game. The visuals echo the style of Japanese painting in striking fashion, and the beautiful music instills a contemplative tone as you swipe to trim the limbs of a rapidly growing tree and guide it around obstacles. Thereâ€™s no frantic pace, no demanding skills to masterâ€”only a quietly bewitching and unforgettable experience.
editorialNotes.short: A contemplative and creative experience - trimming trees has never been so beautiful.

editorialNotes.tagline: This party game is the bomb!

editorialNotes.standard: Come for the satisfaction of solving mysteries; stay for this unforgettable adventureâ€™s lovable characters and excellent writing.

editorialNotes.standard: The solutions are as surreal as the landscapes in this curious hand-drawn adventure.

editorialNotes.standard: Explore a gorgeous island packed with intricately interwoven puzzles. Thereâ€™s a subtle logic to the world design that connects structures, land configurations, and puzzle grids. For persistent adventurers, The Witness is an unforgettable experience.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Get to know your enemyâ€”and try to predict their behaviorâ€”as you solve puzzles in this adventure gameâ€™s top-down dungeons.

A fascinating reinvention of a longtime videogame franchise, Hitman GO takes familiar elements of stealth and assassination and reinterprets them as a wondrously stylized, turn-based boardgame. Each mission presents characters and scenesâ€”some from previous Hitman gamesâ€”as a sleek diorama, blending old and new to create an innovative experience. Even with helpful distractions and places to hide, inching toward your targets a step at a time demands keen strategy, and trying to pull off optional mission objectives quickly becomes an irresistible obsession.

name: Lightbot Jr : Coding Puzzles for Ages 4+

editorialNotes.standard: With Free App of the Week, we highlight a great app you can enjoy at no charge this week. (In-App Purchases sold separately.) ZeptoLabâ€™s highly anticipated sequel is an absolute blast, filled with endless charm and brilliantly designed physics-based puzzles. Use all-new allies and abilities to feed the adorable Om Nom candy while navigating each stageâ€™s unique layout and collecting stars along the way. With new mechanics smartly layered onto the seriesâ€™ already famous gameplay, Cut the Rope 2 is continually challenging and engaging.

editorialNotes.standard: Laugh (and groan) at pop-culture references while solving supernatural crimes in this unabashedly silly point-and-click adventure.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Donut County is an absolute treat. You drag holes across land to collect bigger and bigger aboveground objects, from puddles and fire pits to trees and boulders. New ideas change gameplay in intriguing ways, and concepts never overstay their welcome, making every puzzle feel new and interesting. The consequences of every hole you control propel a wonderfully quirky story about a suddenly subterranean society seeking a return to the surface. Along with the gameâ€™s fantastic visual style and marvelous soundtrack, its every idiosyncrasy miraculously blends into an inviting, cohesive whole.
editorialNotes.short: Geneva Hodgson: Story editor, Donut County
